1.title: Can you hit pause on life?
1.plot: The perfect life, the perfect job and the perfect wife lead a 30-year-old to a life-altering meltdown. Rahul Trivedi has just realised the life he wants is a far cry from the one he's living.

2.title: Baby or Bae?
2.plot: Not wanting a baby is going to make Rahul's life harder he could ever imagine. As for Radha? She's just realised that the real baby is none other than Rahul, who is suddenly clueless about everything.

3.title: On a Sabbatical, From Marriage!
3.plot: Is taking a sabbatical from your marriage a legit excuse to mingle without being single? Adding fuel to the already raging fire? Rahul's hot neighbour Kaya.

4.title: It's Official! We're on a Break.
4.plot: Is a no-strings-attached hookup the best way to get over your ex? Radha discovers a little something on Rahul's neck, and then Rahul discovers Radha at his doorstep - with her hunky new boss.

5.title: Collision Course and Collateral Damage
5.plot: Just when things were starting to look up for Rahul, Radha files for legal separation and decides to move to New York. In a bid to find himself, has Rahul lost his love forever?

6.title: Will He, Won't He?
6.plot: After hitting pause on his life, job and marriage - will the new and improved Rahul 2.0 press play on happiness?

locations: Namah Bungalow, Madh Island, Mumbai, Maharashtra, India::(Rahul & Radha's House)
imdb.plot outline: Rahul and Radha seem to have it all - a happy marriage, a decent job and a beautiful house. But what happens when Radha's pregnancy's announcement makes Rahul realise that he's been living the life he's supposed to and not necessarily the one he wants to? Can a partner hit pause on a seemingly perfect life and re-evaluate his choices? And what about Radha? Is she just collateral damage to Rahul's early mid-life crisis?
imdb.title: Time Out
plot: Rahul and Radha seem to have it all - a happy marriage, a decent job and a beautiful house. But what happens when Radha's pregnancy's announcement makes Rahul realise that he's been living the life he's supposed to and not necessarily the one he wants to? Can a partner hit pause on a seemingly perfect life and re-evaluate his choices? And what about Radha? Is she just collateral damage to Rahul's early mid-life crisis?

Timeout is the coming-of-age story of a 30-something married couple through the medium of an early, for lack of a better phrase, mid-life crisis. Rahul and Radha have been together for 7 years and married for 3 of them. She's the alpha, he's the permanently designated driver. And coasting along the lines of this status quo, they've reached a phase where they've just sunk all their savings into their first house and are now having the most regimented sex in the universe in order to have a baby. All of this is because Radha - who's from the Fire and Ice generation and has the t-shirt to prove it - wants to live by the numbers now. And the next step after 'owning a house' is to 'have a baby'. Rahul, however, suddenly has a meltdown precipitated by several factors - work, finances, discovering his dad's 10-year old affair. The last straw is the positive pregnancy test he discovers in the loo. This becomes the flashpoint for a series of events encompassing fights, breaks, potential affairs past and present and, eventually, a separation while they figure out their lives and, more importantly, themselves. This dysfunctional, emotional and ultimately poignant ride that the couple go on is bolstered by a supporting cast of characters that include their old best friends (married with twins, hence losing it) and new best friends (new boho upstairs neighbours, not a couple and from the generation they're trying to emulate). Ultimately, this is a story about that in-between age when you're not too young, not too old and just not as sorted as thought you would be. It's about discovering yourself and saving each other.
